alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:46AM EST until January 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Raritan River At Raritan affecting Somerset County. For the Raritan River...including Raritan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Branch Raritan River at Raritan. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream on Black River Road. At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs along Old York Road and in North Branch Village. At 13.0 feet, The first evacuations begin in Village of North Branch at Route 28 and Vaanderveer Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.1 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Wednesday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 10/15/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date North Branch Rar Raritan 10.0 12.1 Wed 2 am 5.9 4.2 12.6 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
